header.title: CosPropertyService_PropertySetDef

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosPropertyService::PropertySetDef interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosProperty/include/CosPropertyService.hrl").
This module also exports the functions described in

func.name: get_allowed_property_types(PropertySetDef) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return allowed TypeCodes for the target object

desc.p: This operation return the TypeCodes which we are allowed to use when adding new properties.

func.name: get_allowed_properties(PropertySetDef) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return a sequence of the allowed properties

type.v: PropertyDefs = [#'CosPropertyService_PropertyDef'{property_name = Name, property_value = Value, property_mode = Mode}]
Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined

desc.p: This operation a sequence of the allowed properties we may alter; depends on which mode associated with a certain property.

func.name: define_property_with_mode(PropertySetDef, Name, Value, Mode) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Associate a new property with the target object

type.v: Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined

desc.p: This operation attempts to associate a new property with the target object. If we fail to do so the appropriate exception is raised.

func.name: define_properties_with_modes(PropertySetDef, PropertyDefs) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Associate the given Property Definitions with the target object

type.v: PropertyDefs = [#'CosPropertyService_PropertyDef'{property_name = Name, property_value = Value, property_mode = Mode}]
Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined
Reason = invalid_property_name | conflicting_property | property_not_found | unsupported_type_code | unsupported_property | unsupported_mode | fixed_property | read_only_property

desc.p: This operation attempts to associate the given Property Definitions with the target object. If one or more attempts fail an exception is raised describing which properties we where not able to create.

func.name: get_property_mode(PropertySetDef, Name) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return the mode of the given property

type.v: Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined

desc.p: This operation returns the type of the given property.

func.name: get_property_modes(PropertySetDef, Names) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return the modes of the given properties

type.v: Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined

desc.p: This operation returns the modes of the listed properties. If the boolean flag is false, all properties with mode undefined this operation failed to comply.

type.v: Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined

desc.p: This operation changes the given property's mode. Return the appropriate exception if not able to fulfill the request.

type.v: Mode = normal | read_only | fixed_normal | fixed_readonly | undefined
Reason = invalid_property_name | conflicting_property | property_not_found | unsupported_type_code | unsupported_property | unsupported_mode | fixed_property | read_only_property

desc.p: This operation attempts to update the listed properties mode's. Raises an exception which describe which and why an operation failed.
